text:
Hi, we’re looking to add a an attribute to the HubSpot Tracking script, in order to make it compliant with a cookie tracking script - Specifically we need to set a `data-cookieconsent="xx"`  on the `<script>` tag. However it doesn’t seem possible to edit or change the HubSpot Tracking script when the website in question is hosted on HubSpot CMS.
Do any of you know whether or not it’s possible to alter the script on a HubSpot CMS website, if not directly then through JS or API. I’ve not been able to find any further information on this specifically.
I can set the attribute by catching the script after `window.onload` , but by then it may already be too late to alter, since the cookie most likely has been set before we attach the data-attr.
:point_up: would also like to know if this is possible to allow editors to choose from pro icons

<@UH8USUDNF> so here's what I'm doing for now
`<i _class_="fal fa-{{ feature.feature_icon }}"></i>`
and I have inline help text saying use icon name "shield-check" for example
doesn't get them in the icon field type finder but it's something
Okay <@U01CC0Z39NY> , I think that's the only way if we're using additional icons. Thanks!
